name: From Airy to Zori Quiz | Alphabetical Words | 25 Questions

questions.explanation:
anniversary.

	Other "A" words ending with the REE sound include aerie, armory, artery, auditory, augury, and aviary.

bury.

	Or bakery, battery, berry, or Barry Manilow.

curry.

	Or Carrie Underwood, category, cattery, cemetery, cheery, cherry, Beverly Cleary, Corey Clark, cowrie, Madame Curie, or cursory.

dreary.

	Or dairy, Derry, diary, dory (a flat-bottomed boat) or dowry.

eyrie & eyry.

	Or eerie or Lake Erie or exclusionary or exculpatory.  Since the hint tells you that the answer begins with E, the alternative spellings of aery and aerie won't work.

fury.

	Or fairy, floury, flowery, flurry, or furry.

gory.

	Or Senator Gary Hart, Geary Street in San Francisco, Old Glory, Edward Gorey, Gregory Peck, or grocery store.

Harry.

	Or hairy, hallucinatory, history, hoary, or hurry.

injury.

	Or incendiary.

jury.

	Or Jerry Lewis or jewelry or Jewry.

Kerry.

	Or knavery.

lorry.

	Or laboratory, Laurie Anderson, Timothy Leary, leery, library, or livery.

marry.

	Or Marie, Mary, Maury, merry, midwifery, misery, Missouri, monetary, Murray, or mystery.

nary.

	Or necessary or nonstory.

Opry.

	The Grand Ol' Opry is a theater in Nashville, Tennessee. All the country music stars used to (and may still) get their big breaks there.

parry.

	Or Matthew Perry, potpourri, preliminary, or preparatory.

query.

	Or quackery, quandary, quarry, quavery, or quivery.

questions.text: A telephone with a _______ dial? (Or the local _______ Club?)
questions.explanation:
Rotary.

	Or raillery, rectory, refectory, refinery, refractory, remarry, respiratory, reverie, riflery, rivalry, robbery, rockery, rookery, or rubbery.

questions.text: A watery, insoluble mixture such as mud or plaster of Paris?
questions.explanation:
slurry.

	Or savory, slavery, scary, scurry, showery, sorcery, sorry, surrey (with a fringe on top), stationary, and stationery.

territory.

	Or tannery, tarry, teary, Terry, tertiary, William Makepeace Thackeray, tilbury (a two-wheeled carriage), or Tory.

questions.text: Money lending at an exorbitant interest rate?
questions.explanation:
usury.

	Or unmerry, unsavory, unweary, or urinary.

vagary.

	Or valkyrie (a maiden in Norse mythology), vapory, vary, veery (a songbird), very, vestiary (a changing room), vinegary, vivary (a vivarium), vomitory, or votary.

worry.

	Or wafery, waggery, warty, wary, wasterie (extravagance), watery, wavery, weary, wherry (a rowboat), winery, wintery, wiry, or witchery.

questions.text: I'm skipping X. In Japanese cuisine, marinated chicken pieces on skewers?
questions.explanation:
yakitori & yakatori.

	Or yeomanry.

questions.text: Here's a freebie from the quiz title: A Japanese sandal (or a single flip flop)?
questions.explanation:
zori.

	Or zedoary (a tropical plant's medicinal root). If you liked this quiz, you might try another one from the same section. Now say this FAST: Anniversary, bury, curry, dreary, eyrie, fury, gory, Harry, injury, jury, Kerry, lorry, marry, nary, Opry, parry, query, rotary, slurry, territory, usury, vagary, worry, yakitori, zori!  Thanks, Robbery Raymerry
